author: mightypenguin
content:
Has anyone done work on handling "dust" ETH balances and in ERC20 contracts?
Could we define a storage type in solidity with some configurable magnitude value that would round "dust" eth/token balances to 0 and thus not have to be stored anymore?

author: mightypenguin
content: I think this was done at some ETH upgrade HF in the past, but it was a one time thing and only for ETH balances? Having trouble finding the reference now.

author: mightypenguin
content: I'm somewhat interested (but strapped for time) to analyze how much state storage could be freed by this.

author: mightypenguin
content:
Here's a blast from the past:

author: mightypenguin
content:
I think many of the concerns could be fixed by making the "dust" cleaning configurable.
e.g. Dollar tokens would probably use a much higher limit than WETH.
And this also makes it possible for ERC20 tokens to get this "Dust" handling behavior in a gas efficient way.
